body:
I recelty got a razer mouse, and I'm wondering...

Are macros illegal? and if so. Why?
body_tagged:
I recelty got a razer mouse, and I'm wondering...

Are macros illegal? and if so. Why?
title: Macros

replies.body: Yes. Because They just give you a Unfair advantage compared to users who don't have that possibility/ Si, Porque te dan una gran ventaja contra otros jugadores que no tienen esto. De todas formas, /rules.
replies.body_tagged: Yes. Because They just give you a Unfair advantage compared to users who don't have that possibility/ Si, Porque te dan una gran ventaja contra otros jugadores que no tienen esto. De todas formas, /rules.

replies.body: Wait I have a question. Are macros such as "Good game" and all other text-based allowed? I think yes they are because it's not an advantage for the game itselfs
replies.body_tagged: Wait I have a question. Are macros such as "Good game" and all other text-based allowed? I think yes they are because it's not an advantage for the game itselfs

replies.body:
It's illegal dude, it's like using Autoclicker.
Don't use it, or be prepared to get banned.
replies.body_tagged:
It's illegal dude, it's like using Autoclicker.
Don't use it, or be prepared to get banned.

replies.body: I once knew a Wiseman who asked this question too.
replies.body_tagged: I once knew a Wiseman who asked this question too.

replies.body: Illegal. They give you unfair advantage over others and could get you banned.
replies.body_tagged: Illegal. They give you unfair advantage over others and could get you banned.

replies.body:
I don't believe these are illegal. As long as they don't affect gameplay for your own advantage I guess it's fine.
I knew of a long gone Moderator who would use them for warnings, even though I don't know if that's legal anymore. I don't see any harm on text-based ones, though, as long as it's not used to spam or anything.

replies.body:
Depends on the type of macro. I've got lots of macros with the Macros Mod, and I mean a lot. However they are all command, chat and item macros, not autoclickers or auto bridgers or whatever.

Be more concrete please and we'll give you a concrete answer.
replies.body_tagged:
Depends on the type of macro. I've got lots of macros with the Macros Mod, and I mean a lot. However they are all command, chat and item macros, not autoclickers or auto bridgers or whatever.

Be more concrete please and we'll give you a concrete answer.

replies.body:
Keyboard macros and mouse macros allow short sequences of keystrokes and mouse actions to be transformed into other, usually more time-consuming, sequences of keystrokes and mouse actions. In this way, frequently used or repetitive sequences of keystrokes and mouse movements can be automated. Separate programs for creating these macros are called macro recorders. 



 It's just a extra key on your mouse/keyboard which you can define a action to, so If you want to add the "click" function to the extra key (macro) you can set it up as that.
replies.body_tagged:

In this way, frequently used or repetitive sequences of keystrokes and mouse movements can be automated. Separate programs for creating these macros are called macro recorders. 



 It's just a extra key on your mouse/keyboard which you can define a action to, so If you want to add the "click" function to the extra key (macro) you can set it up as that.

replies.body:
Macros make your life so easy, to the extent of hardly having to do several things by yourself.

I don't think I'd ever say I don't have them, however I always explain what macros I have because in a general basis people associate macros with autoclick so badly.
